website_summaries.verdict: BenQ's HT1075 home-entertainment projector offers reasonably good video quality, 3D capability, and a brightness level suitable for projecting a large image even with the lights on.
pros: Two HDMI connectors, one of which is Mobile High-Definition Link (MHL)-enabled
cons: Shows some judder and rainbow artifacts in video

customer_reviews.title: Inherently Defective Fan Controller Plagues Otherwise Excellent Projector
customer_reviews.text: When it's working, this is a best-in-class projector, however, serious unresolved fan controller issues means these units fail after a few months of use. I just submitted my 2nd RMA for the same "two red lights" error.
customer_reviews.author: Domenic Bonanni

customer_reviews.title: My husband happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great picture. We've had this projector for about a month. Picture clarity is great. Have not tried the 3D option or the wifi hookup option. Since the projector is connected to a receiver not able to speak on the speaker. We replaced this projector with one we've had for five years and the picture is ten times better. We have a dedicated theater room. During the super bowl party that's where most guest migrated to because of the picture. In fact one guess asked if he can camp out in our theater room during NFL season. All our guest was impressed with the picture quality. Set up didn't seem difficult. My husband had it up less than an hour
customer_reviews.author: G Money

customer_reviews.title: ... projectors if you read Projector Central and I was happy with it until I got the dreaded flashing red ...
customer_reviews.text: The HT1075 is one of the "great" budget projectors if you read Projector Central and I was happy with it until I got the dreaded flashing red overheating lights. The latest batches have overheating problems (based on owner posts in the forums and from talking to one of their support guys). My projector overheated and I called for warranty support. The first guy I talked to was great and had me fill out an RMA form and send the form back for an RMA then... crickets. Apparently they're a couple days behind ON JUST GENERATING RMA NUMBERS! I wish I was still inside my Amazon return window.
customer_reviews.author: jacko

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing. Only worked a handful of times.
customer_reviews.text: We had this since 2017 and barley used it more than a handful of times in our home theater. Now when we turn it on it lasts apx 3 minutes before we get an overheating lamp warning. But it’s not hot to the touch or had it been on that long. I tried all the necessary steps to hard reset or their customer service troubleshooting recommendations but none worked
customer_reviews.author: cds

customer_reviews.title: Overheating, overheating, overheating
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit from Amazon in May - by the time we had time to use it in July, we had the problem with overheating and shutting down repeatedly. Amazon replaced the initial unit. THIRTY TWO days after we received the 2nd unit with minimal use, the same problem started happening again. I've spoken with BenQ support, and all they can say is to return it to them to be repaired and it's not a common problem. Obviously, it has become one if two units in 3 months happened in one household. Picture is amazing - but useless when you can't watch a full program in one sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Agile

customer_reviews.title: Overheats
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great when I first purchased it. However, it stopped working within 2-months of purchasing it. The projector overheats and the fan is faulty. The projector shuts off within 15 min of usage. It is covered under warranty but the Ben Q customer service is horrible. I am in week 3 of trying to get a replacement and have been out right lied to about the status of my replacement. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Shimada

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I know some say it had issues overheating...but I have had no problems. I'm a person that keeps my house at 72-74° year round though. It is so wonderful that no one let's me use my TV anymore. I use it 6+ hrs a day and have for months with brilliant colors. It honestly looks better then most high definition televisions ...though it does fade a bit as the bulb ages ...still very great quality picture. I will say that if you want to set it up from the side of the room ...it needs to be further back then the 8-9' in order to achieve the 100" view. Probably closer to 11-12'
customer_reviews.author: ЄXͭΐͪѤͤD ßυяи✯ⓒⓑ

customer_reviews.title: Overheats after 15 minutes and shuts down
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Picture quality is great for an entry level projector Cons: The projector worked well for 32 days, just past the return window. Then the projector began overheating whenever I run it in "normal" lamp mode. The temp and power leds turn red and the projector shuts down after 15-20 minutes that its been on. I'm pretty much at sea level and the room temp was 74-75f which is much below the 40c/104f max temp spec in the manual. The only remedy for this is turning on "high attitude" mode which runs the fans full speed and is very loud, too loud for a HT setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya P.

customer_reviews.title: Buy IT!
customer_reviews.text: This projector changed my life. I can no longer watch football on my $$$$ Panasonic plasma, or my buddies $$$$$ 4k Sony. I can no longer play my XBOX One anywhere else OK why this one versus Epson, Sony, etc. Buy the Benq 1075 if - You don't have someone to calibrate the projector for you (typically $300 -$500 ) - Have less than $900 to spend on a projector - Play video games (super low LAG) - Don't have a perfect theater room / man Cave with dark walls, and zero incoming light. - Sensitive to Fan Noise - Need Zoom and lens shift to help get the picture to line up on the screen
customer_reviews.author: Mechel Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Overheating 20 Days After Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture when it works; however, 20 days in it shuts off every 15 minutes due to overheating. Projector is mounted on the ceiling with nothing around it. Once again Amazon is great and they sent me a new one, hopefully it was just a bad projector (not very optimistic based on some recent reviews).
customer_reviews.author: Travis H. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great projector... for a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I bought this projector. The first suffered from fan failure at about 40 days, the second one had the same issue luckily under the 30 day mark. I will be exploring other options. The first one I will have to contact benQ customer service to get replaced, which I haven't heard great things about. When the projector works, It's great, but I can't give more than a one star review for a product that doesn't last for a reasonable amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: itszando

customer_reviews.title: Always overheating
customer_reviews.text: In less then 2 years, I have sent this back 3 times for overheating. They do send me a refurbished replacement but again the same thing happens. Can't believe there are that many defects that I keep getting. DO NOT BUY THIS PROJECTOR.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Van Wagenen

customer_reviews.title: Overheats even with High Altitude mode turned on
customer_reviews.text: Great picture for both movies and sports. Began overheating consistently within 3 months of use. Unacceptable. I like the price, picture and size but it seems like a fairly common problem that these projectors have. I debated between this and a few more expensive epson projectors and in retrospect wish i had spent a few extra $$. Right before bowl season too... - Updated review to 3 based on excellent customer service from BENQ. Wish I hadn't had the issue in the first place but greatly appreciate the excellent service
customer_reviews.author: Tim Oster

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you want a projector that overheats easily and shuts down
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you want a projector that overheats easily and shuts down. Great for 30 minutes when working, otherwise, just pass. I've owned this for just about 6 months and I regret it unconditionally. Time to see if Amazon or BenQ plan to make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Schrantz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Starting to notice real issues with this unit. Purchased in October and it's already overheating even with routine cleaning. Color flashes are becoming a real problem as well. Not sure how long the warranty is, hopefully a year. Purchased directly from BenQ too.
customer_reviews.author: NDE-Tech

customer_reviews.title: Broke down completely after just 21 months of minimal use( ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke down completely after just 21 months of minimal use( 1-2 hr/week). Will not power itself On. I checked BenQ support team and they say the power board might have failed and will need replacement. Also, past 1 year, the warranty does not cover for the repair. I am now stuck with a dead machine less than 2 years of buying and after paying my hard earned $800. 1/5 stars for durability. For prospective buyers: It is a decent projector but with a major durability issue. take your pick.
customer_reviews.author: Rajiv

customer_reviews.title: Overheating is real
customer_reviews.text: The overheating issues are real. Mine lasted about a year and a half and then overheated and the bulb burst. The extended warrant did nothing and now it just sits there unused. It was a great year though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thamanjimmy

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Amazing. Incredible.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this set up for four days now and I'm not a videophile or anything but I have had projectors before and this is simply the best I've ever seen. There's nothing that has been disappointing yet. Setup with silver ticker str-169120 screen and chromecast. More to come. & update Must lorded active DLP 3d glasses to work. I had to stop mid movie to tell everyone it looks awesome. Using a WD media player with a digital 3d side by side copy of TRON and its better than anything I've seen out side of theaters, even better than most I've see in theaters as well. This is a must have. That's all for now
customer_reviews.author: Thien N.

customer_reviews.title: Great picture. 3D is perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great picture. 3D is perfect. Started overheating and randomly shutting down after several months of use just like countless other reviews have reported. It would be well worth the price if it were not for this issue. Was told by benq it would be a 1 day repair. 2 weeks later and still no projector. After reading all of the reports of the same issue that I am having I will probably look elsewhere in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Swooden

customer_reviews.title: We love this projector
customer_reviews.text: We love this projector. We watch movies, sports, hurricane updates, nature documentaries, basically everything on it. The colors are beautiful, and it's really only limited by our streaming speeds and technology! We could have gotten the short-throw version, but our home theater space was just over the minimum required, and it worked for us. We have not tried the 3D function on it; we don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector and if they can fix the overheating issue...Which they did promptly!!
customer_reviews.text: A really nice projector overall with a great picture and fairly easy to use menu. This is my second projector, the first being a NEC HT1000 which was great when I got it about 5 years ago. However, this projector has been significantly better (really no comparison) in every way until recently when it started overheating and automatically shutting itself down.I have contacted BENQ. I have owned the projector less than a year with less than 600 hours on the lamp and am hopeful they can fix the problem. Details at 11:00...UPDATE: Called BENQ and told them about the problem. They sent an RMA. I had the projector back to me in about 10 days. Nice customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: DLP without the rainbow effect
customer_reviews.text: This is my second projector, an upgrade to a previous DLP of another brand. I had noticed the rainbow effect with the old projector, with its 2X wheel, which over time had become less prominent as my brain adjusted but never totally went away. This new projector with the 6x wheel, I have to really try hard to even notice a hint of rainbow effect - it used to be impossible to ignore during things like white text on black backgrounds, for example the opening titles of The Seventh Seal. Now... practically zero. It is a night and day difference, and probably my favorite aspect of this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two HT1075's and have problems with both. The current one is 18 months old and it shuts off every few hours due to overheating even though the ceiling fan is 2 feet away. I'll be buying an Optima next.
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this projector!
customer_reviews.text: For the first year the projector worked great, as soon as the warranty was up the projector started to overheat. The projector will work perfect for 45 minutes or so then it will overheat. If you read the lower rated reviews they have a lot of issues with this model. I didn't use the projector that often but when I did the picture was amazing. Once it started overheating it's basically useless. Will never buy another Ben Q product, their loss considering how often I upgrade electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy McNelis

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector picture is as good as my sony led ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Projector picture is as good as my sony led tv only bigger.There is nothing like watching a 3d movie on a big screen, there is no crosstalk or rainbow effects on his projector that anyone in my family has seen. Only issue is when you watch a movie that has grain its easier to see it on a big screen but it is not the projectors fault. Looks excellent in a dark room but still good with lights on. Benq HT1075 has a little better picture and a better user menu and remote than the 1070.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome picture quality out of the box Pros
customer_reviews.text: Awesome picture quality out of the box Pros: -Lens shift -Keystone for placing the projector at an angle -Great remote -Better picture quality that the hd141x- better than all sub 1000 projectors that I tried. Color reproduction awesome. -Viewable in the living room even with light. (Though the pictures becomes washed out) -Vertical lens shift -MHL -great zoom -relatively quite for a projector Cons -gets hot -although menus look clean, hard to navigate to Eco mode -no optical out. (Had to buy a hdmi optical extractor to connect to my sonos)
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Taghehchian

customer_reviews.title: Decent project for the price
customer_reviews.text: We had a problem that occurred within the first year that required us to return the projector. BenQ fixed it and sent it back to us. Other than that one issue, it has been a great purchase. We have owned projectors before, and this one is the cheapest in price and the best in terms of picture that we have ever owned. We use it all the time. I hope it continues to be a reliable product once we go beyond the 1-year warranty. It's not too loud, although we live at 4000 feet so I have it in high elevation mode.
customer_reviews.author: HomeTekkie

customer_reviews.title: We are extremely happy and amazed at the quality of the picture
customer_reviews.text: This is our first projector for our new home theater. The screen is 110" and I had to write a review. We are extremely happy and amazed at the quality of the picture. Brilliant and beautiful colors and the quality is absolutely amazing.Very impressed!!!! Highly recommend it and we are so glad that we decided to go with this one.Don't feel the need to pay thousands for another model or brand when this one delivers what we expected and much more.We are looking forward to use it a lot and watch lots of movies and concerts.Just an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: RB Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Keystone Correction Issue
customer_reviews.text: I too had the keystone correction issue, not holding settings. I also returned my first unit via Amazon and receive a 2nd flawed projector. So be aware of the POTENTIAL problem purchasing through Amazon...and feel obligated to share that information. Benq support has been helpful & responsive so far and have offered to exchange the directly. I have yet to determine if it is worth the further headache in my instance. Beyond that I have no formed opinion on the attributes of the projector or picture.
customer_reviews.author: Erik D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent first Projector and mount.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about two weeks and love it so far. Easy setup and install and the picture is excellent. It's like watching a 100 inch TV and I am just projecting on a wall at the moment. Very easy to mount to the BENQ Universal Ceiling mount and the wife actually loves the way it looks. I bolted the mount to a truss in the ceiling and dropped it through the suspended ceiling so nothing above the PJ is visible. Mount has cable management so everything looks professionally installed. If you buy this PJ for a ceiling mount absolutely get the BENQ 5J.J4N10.001 Universal Ceiling mount. Very flexible mount and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: John in North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: BenQ HD1075 new bee...
customer_reviews.text: Have had unit for less than one month, 3rd unit owned over 8yrs or so. Had a dell that pooped out. Also had a Sharp nice little unit first one rather noisy still runs like the energizer rabbit... Miss not being able to disable audio from unit and audio out rca jack, focus is so so.. Pic is standard still learning features. More as time goes on..
customer_reviews.author: Crash&Burn

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this projector. It projects amazing video onto my 10 foot screen. It has a short throw distance which is nice for my smaller space and always amazes guests. If you're looking for a great projector with 1080p resolution and a vivid and bright image, this is the projector for you. To buy any projector better than this, expect to pay another $800-$1000.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bello

customer_reviews.title: This was a great projector, but I had to send back and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great projector, but I had to send back and get the 1085ST because of space limitations. The 1085ST is basically identical, just able to project at a shorter distance. Great picture even with some light entering the room, in my case, sunroom. The projector runs pretty quiet as well, not noticeable while watching movies and the speaker is good, for a basic installation.
customer_reviews.author: Dogman

customer_reviews.title: The real deal for 1080p PC gaming
customer_reviews.text: I use this for pc gaming. My new house has a support pillar in the basement that I must sit my couch behind because putting it in front of the pillar puts it too close to the wall. Therefore I am too far away to continue using my 55 inch TV. This thing, at least in my already dark basement, looks just like a 120 inch 1080p TV. This thing is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: atraeon

customer_reviews.title: Support is a big fat ZERO!
customer_reviews.text: Like the projector. Hate the support. They literally have none. Their 866 number is perm hold and pressing 1 to leave a VM just hangs up on you. I have a fan / overheating issue and I’m willing to pay to have it repaired. BENQ support just won’t respond. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I love it...was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews about overheating. I've had the projector for over two months and has utilized it for up to 5 hours at a time with no problems with overheating. I don't have a screen and I've been reviewing it on a wall and the picture is outstanding. Looking forward to a greater picture when I get my screen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's good, while it works.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have 3 projectors and this is my favorite. Updated Feb 2016: After 5 months this projector started overheating and will not run more than 40 minutes without shutting down.
customer_reviews.author: B. Greenhut

customer_reviews.title: Overheat Central
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Picture quality is very good, pictures looked better than my old Epson and was easy to setup Con: Not nearly as bright as Epson 3LCD projectors, I can see the Epson with a few lights on in the room, for this one to work, it has to be a dark room. It also overheats in less than an hour in a 73F room. Looks like I am not the only one with this issue either. I am sending this back and going back to an Epson.
customer_reviews.author: X. Ying

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I rarely give full stars but this is a brilliant piece of tech. The keystone adjusts vertical and horizontal so you can project from any angle. Crips image, tons of connection on back, audio, hdmi, and more. Audio is solid enough from the projectors speaker for casual setups. The remote and interface are intuitive and it throws short and long distances. Bravo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Great picture, great features, terrible lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Picture is AMAZING. Easy to set up and keystone make it possible for you to put it pretty much anyhwere. But after 4 months, it's already having issues. It keeps overheating and now shuts down after 25 minutes with red lights (POWER and TEMP). Will try to get it replaced and update here but so far, I wouldn't say BenQ offers great quality products, especially if you start searching for similar issues. It seems to be affecting a lot of their projectors.
customer_reviews.author: Guillaume

customer_reviews.title: Works great - just hope you don't get a unit with the bad fan issue....
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the projector until I started having the same overheating problem noted in the 2 star reviews after a little over 1 month of use. I went through the RMA process with BenQ and they said they'll be replacing the fan which supposedly they had a bad batch of. I was told by the CSR that there's a 98% success rate of their being no issues on these units after they're replaced the fan. When I get the replacement, I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: JesseS

customer_reviews.title: Projector Overheating!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT! I bought the projector and it worked fine for about two months after which it began overheating and shutting off automatically at decreasing intervals. Within about a month, it got to the point that I could not even use it for 10 minutes without it overheating!! From the reviews posted above it seems like this is a common problem that BenQ is ignoring! I will not buy another one of their products!
customer_reviews.author: Syed

customer_reviews.title: Look at other brands first!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I consider this a generous review. Had overheating issues where it would just turn off after 10-15 minutes. They repaired it twice and refused to replace it with a new one (i was under warranty too). No Its having an issue flickering colors with whatever you watch, very disorienting. Just a said excuse for a projector. Id gladly take an working projector with worse specs over this failure.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Costa

customer_reviews.title: A nice purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice projector. I ordered a different one first, so returned it and got this one instead. This is for my work, and it is really nice. We have it only about 8' from the screen, so I am not sure how it does long-distance, but short distant it is really clear and works great. This sounds weird to say, but the projector itself is very visually appealing...it looks fancy ;)
customer_reviews.author: Grassshopper021

customer_reviews.title: The Great BenQ
customer_reviews.text: BenQ is the best little ceiling mounted projector we have ever had in our dedicated theater since 1986. The picture is amazing and the mounting was simple. I am so pleased. The last three we had( 2 Infocus and 1 Sony) were so much bigger and one was about 100 pounds and the picture quality couldn't hold a candle to BenQ. Best buy I ever made. I hope it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: maccat

customer_reviews.title: We are VERY happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: We are VERY happy with this product. We are not "techie" people by nature, so we were hoping for something that didn't require a lot of adjustments and custom settings. We wanted it to just work, and it did! The picture is every bit as good as going to the movie theater. We couldn't be happier. Even the speaker is good! We use our surround sound system, so we really weren't worried about it, but it's nice to know that it is very clear/loud -- even for a room as large as ours. We have not tried the 3D feature yet, but honestly don't have much need to. The picture is outstanding as is. 5 starts for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Heather H.

customer_reviews.title: Major overheating issues
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is quite good on the projector. But in about 7-8 months of conservative use (2-3 hour week), it has developed some overheating problems. The fans are loud enough to be uncomfortable in just a few minutes of use. The projector has shut itself down several times when it gets too hot. Overall not very reliable despite decent video quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie N

customer_reviews.title: Bought the projector and picture quality was very good. At times the bulb seem to overheat and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the projector and picture quality was very good. At times the bulb seem to overheat and red flashing light came on especially between power cycling. The major complaint is that after 1 week of use the onboard speaker blew out. When I called tech support, the guy asked me if I could just "turn off" the speaker. If hte speaker blows after a week, I have little faith in quality control overall....
customer_reviews.author: DR. LAL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Better colors and brightness than the BenQ 1070
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Better colors and brightness than the BenQ 1070. I had purchased the 1070 first to try it and then used the HT1075. Immediately noticed a difference in colors and brightness level so ended up returning the 1070. Sound is a bit better as well compared to 1070. I have a nice setup now with this projector. All I need now is to put up a box office outside to sell tickets to my personal theater. Lol!
customer_reviews.author: M. Rassiwala

customer_reviews.title: Great home theater projector.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great projector for home or office use. I have it installed as a home theater projector and it has work out great. Excellent clarity, bright image, and no noticeable fan noise. Highly recommended. UPDATE: After about 6 months of usage the internal fan failed and the unit wouldn't operate. I had to ship the projector back to California at my own cost but it was repaired and returned quickly.
customer_reviews.author: SouthIndiana

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, but doesn't work after three months.
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned this projector for three months and it has now had the same thing happen as many other complaints here. Periodically shuts off with two red lights on. BenQ North America does not answer their customer services number and it says their voicemail is full. I have submitted a replace request on their generic submission form on their website. I will update if they respond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now, this is really amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Staggering how clean this image looks! Compared to Sony VPL-HS51 and The Epson PowerLite Home Cinema 8100, the BenQ HT1075 is better across the board. I know, I know, it is an unfair apples to oranges comparison because the other projectors are much older technology. But wow, the price I paid for the others and the image and quality I get with the BenQ make me grateful that technological progress is alive and well.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyRAW

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is good.. But the unit after 3 months has ...
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is good.. But the unit after 3 months has been shutting off due to overheating.. Now the lamp is out and its only been 6 months. No way have I used 2000 hours as this has only been used for movies and the occasional xbox. Now I have to go through the warranty process because I am now past the return policy with Amazon. I am very discouraged that and bummed that this unit didn't work out.. Once fixed, going on Craigslist to get some of my money back and hope after its fixed, someone else will have better luck than I..
customer_reviews.author: KenR

customer_reviews.title: Buy One!
customer_reviews.text: This will change the way you watch movies, sports, shows and everything else. I have had it projected onto a 100 inch screen for over a year and I will never go back. When you go to friends houses and watch stuff on their 55 inch led tv you will laugh. Overall it's a wonderful product with great value especially considering what you get from it. You will feel like you are at the movie theater. Get one and you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The black levels are a little washed out and no where near my plasma but they look great for the price and size of the image
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a Panasonic Plasma I was very worried about the image quality, especially the black levels. So far I am extremely impressed with the overall picture most notably the brightness and color. The black levels are a little washed out and no where near my plasma but they look great for the price and size of the image.
customer_reviews.author: MrBeardman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality projector, short bulb life
customer_reviews.text: We were loving this projector but just short of 1.5 years old the bulb exploded (very audible, very much scared my husband). We have no where close to 3,000 hours on this bulb so we're wary of shelling out $130 for a bulb every other year.
customer_reviews.author: MKT

customer_reviews.title: Great projector. wanted something for the video games and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. wanted something for the video games and movies in the basement that would be HD. The BenQ has been great, games are crisp and clear with the PS4. Movies are excellent. You wont go wrong with this product. Now keep in mind we mounted in on the ceiling and it mounting distance was like 13' if I remember. So if you couch is farther back then the projector will be ahead of yah.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for business.
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the value on this projector. It has a beautiful and bright picture. Not sure on the motion and action for movies, but it's awesome in a business environment. The picture is super clear and easy to read, even when the room is lit up. We highly recommend this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Over heating problem after just 1100hrs and no apparent fix
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing how a user manual can inspire you to buy a product. I bought this projector based on the fact that BenQ took the time to explain and give pictorial examples of BRIGHTNESS, CONTRAST, SHARPNESS COLOR TEMP, etc. I bought it and used the examples in the manual and WOW! "that was all she wrote" I have three other projectors that I had to guess what all these meant. I am really impressed by the picture quality and it was really easy to set up. Kudos BenQ!
customer_reviews.author: p

customer_reviews.title: The picture quality of the BenQ is much superior than the Epson that he purchased a little over ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this projector after I had seen an installation at my step-son's home. He had an Epson.The picture quality of the BenQ is much superior than the Epson that he purchased a little over a year ago. As far as I'm concerned, the picture quality is at a par with a $2,000.00 TV!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift after doing much research for my extremely tech minded engineer hubby. I'm not a techie so I took the advise of those that are and this has been a fantastic find. Easy to watch during the day or night! My husband was so pleased and thought much better of my technical skills (ha!). Was quick and easy to set up and the instructions were well written and easy for even me to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Simply Superb!!
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before buying this projector and had pretty high expectations. Still this thing surpassed what I had hoped for. Looks great on a blank wall and even better on my 150 inch .95 gain screen. Rich colors, deep blacks and is very watchable with the lights on. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: aaron c oquist

customer_reviews.title: Projector seems to be performing fine. I am not noticing much difference the the ...
customer_reviews.text: Projector seems to be performing fine. I am not noticing much difference the the various illumination levels. The BENQ mount wobbles. After a month of using this projector, I am extremely satisfied with the performance. Since the mount is attached to joists in the attic, the wobbles are only a concern during alignment. We have had no issues since then.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Mays

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Great projector! I use it in the family room with ambient light on a wall(researching retractable screens). As with any projector the picture does noticeably fade around noon in the summer when it's brightest outside. Close a few curtains and your good to go. At night the colors look great even with the lights on. Pros: Colors really pop. Great picture quality. Easy setup. Looks great with default settings. Tolerates light. Not loud Cons: None worth complaing about for the price of this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Williams

customer_reviews.title: 5 increments of volume or expanded the min->max range I'd be pretty stoked. Built in speakers go from unhearable to ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish the volume controls were more granular. If they issued a software update that let you do .5 increments of volume or expanded the min->max range I'd be pretty stoked. Built in speakers go from unhearable to quiet to loud with little inbetween.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Z

customer_reviews.title: Overheating Problem
customer_reviews.text: This projector was great ... for a little while. And then we experienced the same problem other reviewers discuss: overheating for no apparent reason within less than an hour of use, which, of course, makes the projector pretty much unusable. I cannot recommend this projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: everything is good, except
customer_reviews.text: everything is good, except, that it doesnt fit exactly into the screen size. I see the odd angles to the corners, instead of being exact 90 degree angles. I tried various ways to set it right, but couldnt do it. On the whole it is a great product. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hari Vunnava

customer_reviews.title: Make a home theater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we did some remodeling, and there was no good place for a TV. In the process, I realized that I had a nice space in my new basement, and turned it into a home theater. I created my own screen from a 4x8 piece of masonite painted with ultrawhite satin paint. The results are wonderful. I now have a 100+ inch HD screen. The BENQ allows me to put the projector off to the side and use the keystone setting to make it square.
customer_reviews.author: Norman H White

customer_reviews.title: Looks and works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This was worth the money!!!!! Looks and works great!!!!! It's been the hub of so many sport events. Buy it!!! Take the time to compare to others and it still wins
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Great projector for under $1,000
customer_reviews.text: This is a great projector. We use it in our conference room with the lights on and have no issue seeing what is on the screen. Update after a weeks worth of use the lamp died on this unit. We'll see how well the replacement holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Renovator

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Looks great. No rainbow effect at all. This is my first probjector, so I haven't had any experience with others, but this thing looks like a tv. Even in a lighted basement it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Phennecke

customer_reviews.title: great projector, but had an overheating lamp issue and ...
customer_reviews.text: great projector, but had an overheating lamp issue and had to send it in.. and pay for one way shipping. So that sucked !
customer_reviews.author: Mihai Oprescu

customer_reviews.title: Great Projector!
customer_reviews.text: I get a lot of great comments about this projector since I purchased it at the beginning of the year. Most people are shocked about the price thinking I had spent double what I spent. I have recommended it to a few others as well. With projectors, it's all about budget and this one fit mine and would recommend to those who are under $1k budget.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gassel

customer_reviews.title: This thingermabob is fantastic. Great image quality
customer_reviews.text: This thingermabob is fantastic. Great image quality, great brightness, cheap, zero complaints etc. An unexpected bonus is that it can project a quite large image with only limited distance from the screen. My living room is maybe 10-12 feet wide, and the projector manages an enormous 120 inch picture without any distortion.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W Dupont

customer_reviews.title: Extremely clear picture! Screen can change sizes. We ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely clear picture! Screen can change sizes. We have ours hanging on a ceiling. Will never buy a tv again after buying this projector! What a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Absolutely 1st class in it's league
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of research led me to this. I bought it, I use it, I love it. Absolutely 1st class in it's league. Just do it.
customer_reviews.author: Luke J. Axelson

customer_reviews.title: Benq Ht1075 nothing but positive reviews projected for the future.
customer_reviews.text: Not the grainy projection quality of the past. It's damn close to being damn close to perfect! Great color and clarity. Lots of adjustable settings, easy to use well lit remote, well worth the cost and I would consider a second unit as a refurb if in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Mark McMorris

customer_reviews.title: Great projector
customer_reviews.text: Great projector. Easy to use and setup. I'm throwing a 167" diagonal great quality picture from 17-18ft back. Quiet running and love the backlit remote.
customer_reviews.author: JDG

customer_reviews.title: A+ overall expect the fan noise.
customer_reviews.text: just runs a little too noisy for my taste. But projects excellent quality picture. I m using it with a 150 inch screen and love it. Whoever in my family and friend circle saw the results for the first time got carried away.
customer_reviews.author: ssheikh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. So glad I spent the extra money and ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow is all I have to say. We watched 3D movies over PS3 and Roku (netflix). Amazing. So glad I spent the extra money and got the newer version. Have not mounted it on the ceiling yet so it is sitting on a table.
customer_reviews.author: T. Denton

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about 9 months, then started shutting off after about 10 minutes of run time because the lamp was overheating. We tried all the troubleshooting tricks and no luck. I know it's not a top of the line projector, for for the money we paid I expected it to last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lani

customer_reviews.title: Nice bright display, good sound.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright display. Good sound built in. High resolution. Flexible display options.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Zoom and offset adjustment not as easy as on my Panansonic AE900 this replaced
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding projector for the money. Zoom and offset adjustment not as easy as on my Panansonic AE900 this replaced, but once I got it set, who cares?
customer_reviews.author: Christer Whitworth

customer_reviews.title: Nothing else comes close
customer_reviews.text: Best projector for the money. Nothing else even comes close. Forget about the "rainbow artifacts" that the nerds talk about. They don't exist. Amazing picture. Completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Shuts down on overheat after 30 min once you can't return it anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it. It worked great for 2 months. Then it started doing auto-shutdown on overheat after <30 min of being on. I sent it back to the manufacturer for warranty repair, which meant I had to be without a TV for a week. They sent me a brand new one, which worked great for 2 months, and now shuts down on overheat after <30 min of being on. I've even tried blowing an external fan directly on it to no avail. We live in Denver, and it does have a "high-altitude cooling mode". I turned it on as soon as I received both projectors, but it didn't prevent this issue.
customer_reviews.author: elia

customer_reviews.title: I love my DLP Projector, it's more than AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Yahoo! I got my own theater. Feel proud to have such quality projector BenQ HT1075. I love the picture quality of this projector. It is more than I expected. I am on third week using this, till now no complaints/regrets on this purchase. I love Amazon fast 1 day free shipping. I recommend this item how are looking for high quality projector for just peanut (less than $900 but quality more than $2000 worth projector) price.
customer_reviews.author: VASU VELAGA

customer_reviews.title: Overheating problem due to design flaw: DON’T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Overheating problem, as previously noted. Don’t buy this. Great picture, but after 6 months, totally unusable.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Tupper

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box perfect picture. I recently returned a pro8300 projector because ...
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box perfect picture. I recently returned a pro8300 projector because for home theater it was awful looking. The picture from this projector is just stunning. Just unpack and plug in for a great picture.
customer_reviews.author: darryl douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these instead of a TV set, and glad we did. We get spectacular quality without having an ugly set sitting on a table. Now, with this, Amazon Instant Video, Netflix, and a Roku, we're happy "cord-cutters".
customer_reviews.author: LOL

customer_reviews.title: Issue after 1.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for 1.5 years. Occasionally the image flickers red green blue. At this moment theres a constant 2' black hairline flicker on the left side of the image.
customer_reviews.author: vainius

customer_reviews.title: True HD with 120" screen.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is amazing. Easy to set up. For the price there is nothing to complain about it. Hopefully it lasts long.
customer_reviews.author: vill klinton

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great picture quality and brightness. I am able to watch it in our pretty light room during the day no problem. I'm getting a strange flickering every couple of minutes, but this may be due to a too long HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylyn Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Great projector when it isn't overheating
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, but after 4 months and 900 hours of lamp, it started shutting down with the overheating issue that many others have reported. About to contact Benq and see how good their support is.
customer_reviews.author: Uwe Hale

customer_reviews.title: Sent a faulty Projector
customer_reviews.text: I got this and only half the screen would light up. I called BenQ and they said I was sent a projector with a bad DLP Card and to return it. So far this has been a big hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome projector.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome projector. ... I am kinda traveller and honestly I love this projector... p.s. I have using this since last 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Abheetk

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The projector's juxtaposition is off, making it difficult to fit the picture perfectly on the screen.
customer_reviews.author: TexasBikerGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent projector for less than $1,000 budget
customer_reviews.text: Great picture - We use this projector for gaming and works perfect. I did a lot of research before buying - This projector meets all gaming/video needs for for a budget < $1,000.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else, amazing features for the money spent. I've always loved DLP for the silky smooth picture and fast response. I don't mind the color wheel, but I can still catch a hint of the rainbow effect in high contrast areas.
customer_reviews.author: cell21633

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: good picture. Great in daylight too. keystone is a great feature. Volume control on the remote is a great feature and eco mode to turn off the projection is nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely blown away at how good this looks on my screen. My kids are loving watching movies on this, and for me, football/basketball viewing will never be the same. The reviews are accurate - for this price range this BenQ unit is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F

product_meta.title: BenQ HT1075 1080p 3D DLP Home Theater Projector
product_meta.description: Style:Projector OnlyExperience cinematic quality right in your home with the HT1075. Delivering 2,200 lumens, the HT1075 allows you to enjoy accurate, crisp, and long-lasting colors with BenQ Colorific technology. Enjoy streaming content wirelessly. Setup is easy.
feature_bullets: Screen Size Range: 40-inches from 3.85 feet; 235-inches from 22.5 feet
Contrast Ratio: 10,000:1; Keystone Correction: Yes; Lens Shift: Yes
Warranty: 1 Year Parts/Labor; 180 day or 500 hours of lamp life; Lamp Life: Up to 3500 hours (normal) and 5000 hours (economic mode)
2 HDMI; 1 MHL (Shared with HDMI -2); wireless HDMI enabled (optional accessory)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars438 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
